SEARCH
Module com.example.form
Package org.uwo.cs2212

Class MapEditingController

java.lang.Object
org.uwo.cs2212.MapEditingController
public class MapEditingController extends Object
This class is the controller for the Campus Map application. It handles the UI actions, such as zooming in and out, selecting points of interest (POIs), adding and deleting POIs, and loading maps for different floors. It also contains methods for converting between window and real map coordinate systems, as well as for handling mouse events. ------- The CampusMapController class works in conjunction with the FloorMap, PointOfInterest, ImageLayer, and Layer classes, as well as the FXML view files to provide a complete map navigation and editing experience.
Author:
Tingrui Zhang, Binchi Zhang

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()

    • showMap

      protected void showMap()
      This method is responsible for loading and displaying the map of the currently selected floor. It takes the map file name from the currentFloorMap, loads the image, and creates an ImageView to display it. It also creates ImageLayer instances for each layer in the currentFloorMap, adjusting their size and position based on the zoom factor.

      In case of any exceptions during the loading or processing of the map or layers, the exception is caught and no further action is taken.

    • setCurrentFloorMap

      public void setCurrentFloorMap(FloorMap currentFloorMap)
      Sets the current floor map and loads it for editing.
      Parameters:
      currentFloorMap - the FloorMap object representing the current floor map

    • hitTest

      private boolean hitTest(javafx.geometry.Point2D mousePosition, PointOfInterest poi)
      Checks whether a given point of interest (POI) is "hit" by a mouse click at the given real-world position, taking into account the current zoom level of the map. If the distance between the POI and the mouse position is less than or equal to 6 pixels (scaled according to the current zoom level), the POI is considered hit and this method returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.
      Parameters:
      mousePosition - the real-world position of the mouse click
      poi - the point of interest to check for a hit
      Returns:
      true if the POI is hit by the mouse click, false otherwise

    • onEditorMapClicked

      private void onEditorMapClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Handles mouse clicks on the editor map by determining the real-world position of the click and checking if any point of interest (POI) is located at that position. If a POI is found, its name, type, room number, and description are stored in the corresponding fields, and the POI is selected. If no POI is found, the current POI is deselected. The map is then updated to show the selected POI, if any.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - the MouseEvent object representing the mouse click event

    • selectPoi

      private void selectPoi(SearchResult searchResult)
      Selects a point of interest (POI) and updates the current floor map to the floor map associated with the POI's location. If a POI is currently selected, its "selected" property is set to false before selecting the new POI. If a POI is selected, its "selected" property is set to true. Finally, the map is updated to show the new floor map and the selected POI.
      Parameters:
      searchResult - the SearchResult object representing the selected POI and its associated floor map

    • onZoomInButtonClick

      private void onZoomInButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the event when the "Zoom In" button is clicked in the UI. ----- This method updates the zoom level of the campus map and displays the updated map. If the current zoom level is already at its maximum (0.5), the "Zoom In" button is disabled.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - an ActionEvent object representing the click event

    • onZoomOutButtonClick

      private void onZoomOutButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the event when the "Zoom Out" button is clicked in the UI. ----- This method updates the zoom level of the campus map and displays the updated map. If the current zoom level is already at its minimum (1.7), the "Zoom Out" button is disabled.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - an ActionEvent object representing the click event

    • returnBack

      private void returnBack(String file, String title, javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is responsible for transitioning to a new view/window within the application.
      Parameters:
      file - The FXML file name for the target view.
      title - The title for the new window.
      actionEvent - an ActionEvent object representing the click event
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown if the fxmlLoader doesn't have a proper file to load

    • loadMapForEditing

      private void loadMapForEditing()
      Loads the map for editing by retrieving the map file, creating an ImageView of the map, and adding layers to the map as ImageLayers.

    • onCloseButtonClick

      public void onCloseButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws RuntimeException
      Handles the event when the "Close" button is clicked in the UI.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - an ActionEvent object representing the click event
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an IOException occurs during the execution of the returnBack method

    • onAddPOIButtonClick

      public void onAddPOIButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Adds a new point of interest (POI) to the current floor map configuration file. The new POI's name, room number, description, and type are obtained from the corresponding text fields and combo box in the GUI. If any of these fields are empty, an error dialog is shown indicating that all fields must be filled. If a POI with the same name or room number already exists in the configuration file, an error dialog is shown indicating that a different name or room number must be used. If a layer exists in the configuration file with the same type as the new POI, the new POI is added to that layer's list of points. If no such layer exists, a new layer is created and the new POI is added to that layer's list of points. If the POI is successfully added, an information dialog is shown indicating success.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event that triggered this method
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading from or writing to the configuration file

    • WindowPointToRealPoint

      private javafx.geometry.Point2D WindowPointToRealPoint(javafx.geometry.Point2D windowPoint)
      Converts a point in the window coordinate system to a point in the real map coordinate system. Takes into account the current zoom level and scroll position.
      Parameters:
      windowPoint - The point in the window coordinate system
      Returns:
      The converted point in the real map coordinate system

    • calculateRealMousePosition

      private javafx.geometry.Point2D calculateRealMousePosition(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Calculates the real-world position of the mouse based on the given mouse event.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - the mouse event containing the mouse position in window coordinate.
      Returns:
      a Point2D object representing the real-world position of the mouse

    • onDeletePOIButtonClick

      public void onDeletePOIButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Deletes a point of interest (POI) from the current floor map configuration file. The POI to be deleted is determined by the values of the roomName, roomType, and poiRoomNumber fields, which must be set prior to calling this method. If the POI is found and deleted, an information dialog is shown indicating success. If the POI is not found, an error dialog is shown indicating that the POI could not be deleted.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event that triggered this method
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading from or writing to the configuration file

    • onEditPOIButtonClick

      public void onEditPOIButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Edits a point of interest (POI) in the current floor map configuration file. The POI to be edited is determined by the values of the roomName, roomType, and poiRoomNumber fields, which must be set prior to calling this method. The new values for the POI's name, room number, description, and type are obtained from the corresponding text fields and combo box in the GUI. If any of these fields are empty, an error dialog is shown indicating that all fields must be filled. If the POI is found and edited, an information dialog is shown indicating success. If the POI is not found, an error dialog is shown indicating that a POI must be selected for editing.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event that triggered this method
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading from or writing to the configuration file

    • clearFields

      private void clearFields()
      This method clears all the fields for entering information about the POI

    • setFields

      private void setFields()
      This method sets the fields for entering information to the currently selected POI's information
